title: Understanding the Reaction Equation
text: The balanced chemical equation for the combustion of ethene is: C2H4+3O2->2CO2+2H2O. This means $$1$$ mole of C2H4 reacts with $$3$$ moles of O2.

title: Calculate Moles of Each Reactant
text: To find the limiting reagent, calculate the moles of each reactant. Use the molar mass: C2H4 is $$28$$ $$\frac{g}{mol}$$ and O2 is $$32$$ $$\frac{g}{mol}$$.

title: Determine Moles of Ethene
text: Calculate the moles of ethene: $$195$$ g divided by $$28$$ $$\frac{g}{mol}$$.

title: Determine Moles of Oxygen
text: Calculate the moles of oxygen: $$112$$ g divided by $$32$$ $$\frac{g}{mol}$$.

title: Compare the Mole Ratios
text: Compare the mole ratios from the balanced equation to the calculated moles to determine which reactant is the limiting reagent.
